_comment: This is an example config file.
_comment2: All config files MUST be named '_config.json'.

default-settings/source-folder/._comment: This lists all default settings for a folder configuration entry.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment2: Keys ending with slash or backslash indicate folders. All images and sub-folders in this folder inherit settings defined here.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment3: Non-default configuration for sub-folders and individual images will override these settings.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_ignore: If true, every image in this folder and sub-folders is ignored.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_ignore2: You can set it to false in the config entry of a sub-folder or an image to process images once more.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_override: Relative paths in override determine where images in the config file's directory get saved in the game's graphics folder.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_override2: If there are paths in override, both include and exclude must not exist or must be empty.
default-settings/source-folder/._note_override: IMPORTANT: All paths listed here must have defined instructions in settings.json.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_include: Relative paths in include get added to the paths given in the config files of parent directories.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_include2: A path cannot exist in both include and exclude.
default-settings/source-folder/._note_include: IMPORTANT: All paths listed here must have defined instructions in settings.json.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_exclude: Relative paths in exclude get removed from the paths given in the config files of parent directories.
default-settings/source-folder/._note_exclude: IMPORTANT: All paths listed here must have defined instructions in settings.json.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_image_centre_y: When trimming an image, this determines the centre-point of the trimmed image on Y-axis. The value should be between 0.0 and 1.0.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_image_centre_y2: The value 0.0 means that pixels from the bottom of the image are trimmed, while top of the image is preserved.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_image_centre_y3: The value 1.0 means that pixels from the top of the image are trimmed, while bottom of the image is preserved.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_image_centre_y4: The value 0.5 means that pixels from the top and bottom are trimmed as equally as possible.
default-settings/source-folder/._note_image_centre_y: In most cases you would want to set this individually for each image that you do not want to be centred when trimmed.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_image_centre_x: When trimming an image, this determines the centre-point of the trimmed image on X-axis. The value should be between 0.0 and 1.0.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_image_centre_x2: The value 0.0 means that pixels from the right of the image are trimmed, while left of the image is preserved.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_image_centre_x3: The value 1.0 means that pixels from the left of the image are trimmed, while right of the image is preserved.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_image_centre_x4: The value 0.5 means that pixels from the left and right are trimmed as equally as possible.
default-settings/source-folder/._note_image_centre_x: In most cases you would want to set this individually for each image that you do not want to be centred when trimmed.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_folder: In settings.json, {folder} is a placeholder value which is normally replaced by the name of the folder where the source image is.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_folder2: A non-empty string overrides this default behaviour and sets the folder name to whatever is written.

default-settings/source-image._comment: This lists all default settings for a source image configuration entry.
default-settings/source-image._comment2: Keys not ending with slash or backslash indicate images. Settings defined here only affect that particular image.
default-settings/source-image._comment3: Note that you MUST NOT include file extensions in the image keys.
default-settings/source-image._comment4: These settings work the same way as in the folder configuration.
default-settings/source-image._comment5: The settings below only work in source image configurations.
default-settings/source-image._comment_save_as: Normally the image will be saved with the same name as the source image.
default-settings/source-image._comment_save_as2: This setting can be used to override that behaviour. Do not include the file extension.
default-settings/source-image._note_save_as: Useful if you want to have a different source image for a particular logo size, for example.
default-settings/source-image._comment_duplicates: If you want to use the same source logo for multiple teams, list them all here. Do not include the file extension.

.._comment: This is an example configuration for a folder and its sub-folders.
.._comment2: Key with only a dot ('.') indicates that these settings apply to the same folder where the config file is, and its sub-folders.
.._override_comment: This configuration erases all prior instructions, if any, for saving images in the game's graphics folder.
.._override_comment2: In this case, they are replaced by processing and saving the source images of this folder and all sub-folders in clubs' huge, large, medium and small folders.
.._folder_comment: The {folder} in the above override setting is replaced by 'National Hockey League'.
.._folder_comment2: All source images in this folder and sub-folders would be saved to:

example-image._comment: This is an example configuration for an individual image.
example-image._comment_image_centre_y: If the processed image needs to be trimmed to fit its container, the image's centre-point will be 20% from the top edge.
example-image._comment_exclude: The source image retains all prior instructions of where to save it in the graphics folder, apart from the medium logo.
example-image._comment_save_as: Instead of being saved with the name 'example-image', the name of the processed images will be 'Helsingin Jokerit' in the game's graphics folder.
example-image._comment_duplicates: Every processed image is also saved as these image names.
example-image._comment_duplicates2: In our example, the source image 'example-image' would be saved as
example-image._comment_duplicates3: 'Helsingin Jokerit', 'Helsingin Jokerit A-Jrs' and 'Helsingin Jokerit B-Jrs' in the game's graphics folder.
